__e: God reminded me today that I've always had a dream, a very private dream, one I never talked about.
He thought of you before he died, so you make him out to be a hero.
She made me think she felt the same way about me until she remembered she had other fish to fry.
During all those years, Was there ever a moment when... you thought of me?
He said, passing the park, he'd seen the house and thought of me,
Why this renewed interest in my affairs?
It-It reminded me of a wooden Indian statue-- you know, the kind that stand outside those old-time saloons.
It had us stymied until one of my men remembered an intercept from March.
Tell him it's the neighbor across the street who just remembered he was young once, too.
And Sam used you to make me jealous and then when push came to shove, he finally remembered what a wonderful thing we have together.
Nevertheless, what I can't understand is why... he remembered us after all these years.
In some manner, he was reminiscent of my father.
No matter if you are cute or clever, the most important thing is you remembered my birthday.
I'll bet you didn't give us folks out here a thought.
In some manner, he was reminiscent of my father.
No matter if you are cute or clever, the most important thing is you remembered my birthday.
The head of state recalled the attack on the child by migrants within the EU and stressed that "a society that is not able to protect their children today, has no tomorrow".
Oh, something she read in the papers, remembered my name.
You remembered what I read to you about love our neighbour.
Now that you call my attention to it, I guess I am.
Experience was different because it reminded me of this, but next time I think you can write about the amazing Japanese food in Canada until now.
Me, with no talent, as you kept reminding me my whole life!
They are from those who remember his kindness.
Good thing the girl remembered the sister.
This morning, he didn't even remember the party at the hotel last night.
